Maths.question: A prime number is divisible by 1 and itself only.
A triangle can have two right angles.
The slope of a vertical line is undefined.
The product of two negative numbers is always negative.
The equation of a line in slope-intercept form is y = mx + b.
The Pythagorean Theorem states that a^2 + b^2 = c^2.
An acute angle measures greater than 90 degrees.

Physics.question: An object in motion tends to stay in motion, and an object at rest tends to stay at rest.
In physics, acceleration is the rate at which an object changes its direction.
The force required to maintain an object's motion in a straight line is called centripetal force.
The buoyant force exerted on an object in a fluid is equal to the weight of the fluid displaced by the object.
The kinetic energy of an object is equal to its mass times its acceleration.
In physics, work is defined as the product of an object's mass and its velocity.
The angle of incidence is equal to the angle of reflection.
The speed of light is the fastest possible speed in the universe.
Electric current flows from negative to positive.
In physics, power is the rate at which work is done.

Chemistry.question: Water is an example of a chemical element.
An acid is a substance that releases hydrogen ions in water.
The atomic number of an element is equal to the number of protons in its nucleus.
An exothermic reaction releases heat into its surroundings.
A catalyst increases the rate of a chemical reaction by increasing the activation energy.
The pH scale measures the acidity or basicity of a solution.
A mole is a unit of measurement for the number of particles in a substance.
Electronegativity is a measure of an atom's ability to attract electrons in a chemical bond.
Oxidation is the process of gaining electrons.
An endothermic reaction absorbs heat from its surroundings.

Biology.question: The human body has four chambers in the heart.
Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert sunlight into chemical energy.
The mitochondria are the powerhouses of the cell, producing ATP for energy.
DNA stands for deoxyribonucleic acid.
The human body has a total of 206 bones.
The pancreas produces insulin, which regulates blood sugar levels.
A virus is a type of bacteria.
The ribosome is the site of protein synthesis in a cell.
The process of meiosis results in the production of two identical daughter cells.
The function of the red blood cells is to carry oxygen to the body's tissues.

English.question: A verb is a word that describes an action.
An adjective is a word that modifies a verb.
A simile is a figure of speech that compares two things using 'like' or 'as'.
A preposition is a word that shows the relationship between a noun or pronoun and other words in a sentence.
An adverb is a word that modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb.
A metaphor is a figure of speech that describes something by saying it is something else.
The subject of a sentence is the person or thing that performs the action.
A pronoun is a word used in place of a noun.

Social.question: The United States has a bicameral legislative system, consisting of the House of Representatives and the Senate.
The Emancipation Proclamation, issued by President Abraham Lincoln, declared all slaves in the Confederate States to be free.
The Cold War was a military conflict between the United States and Germany.
The American Revolution was fought to gain independence from England.
The Great Depression was a severe economic downturn that began in the United States in 1929.
The Civil Rights Act of 1964 outlawed discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.
The Supreme Court case of Brown v. Board of Education ruled that segregation in public schools was unconstitutional.
The Articles of Confederation were the first governing document of the United States.
The Vietnam War was fought between North and South Korea.
The 19th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution granted women the right to vote.

C.question: C is a high-level programming language.
In C, the keyword 'int' is used to declare a variable of integer type.
The '++' operator in C is used to increment a variable by one.
C is a compiled language, meaning that the code is translated into machine code before execution.
The 'if' statement in C is used for conditional execution of code.
A function in C can only return a single value.
In C, a 'struct' is a user-defined data type that groups together variables of different data types under a single name.
The 'switch' statement in C is used to select one of several code blocks to be executed.
C does not support object-oriented programming.
The 'while' loop in C is used for iterative execution of code as long as a condition is true.

C++.question: C++ is a high-level programming language.
In C++, the keyword 'new' is used to dynamically allocate memory for an object at runtime.
The '>>' operator in C++ is used for output.
C++ is an interpreted language, meaning that the code is translated into machine code before execution.
The 'virtual' keyword in C++ is used to create a virtual function in a base class that can be overridden in derived classes.
A constructor in C++ is a special member function that is called when an object is created.
In C++, the 'const' keyword is used to specify that a variable cannot be modified.
The '->' operator in C++ is used to access the members of an object through a pointer.
In C++, the 'this' pointer is used to refer to the object that called the member function.
C++ does not support exception handling.

Java.question: Java is an interpreted language, meaning that the code is translated into machine code before execution.
In Java, the keyword 'final' is used to specify that a variable cannot be modified.
The '==' operator in Java is used to test for object identity.
Java supports multiple inheritance.
The 'for' loop in Java is used for iterative execution of code.
In Java, a constructor is a special method that is called when an object is created.
Java does not support operator overloading.
The 'interface' keyword in Java is used to define a collection of abstract methods that can be implemented by classes.
Java supports automatic garbage collection.
The 'try-catch' block in Java is used for exception handling.

DBMS.question: DBMS stands for Database Management System.
A database in DBMS is a collection of related data.
In DBMS, the SQL language is used to manipulate data in a database.
A table in DBMS is a collection of related records.
A view in DBMS is a virtual table that is based on the result of a SELECT query.
In DBMS, the primary key is used to uniquely identify a record in a table.
A foreign key in DBMS is a column or set of columns in one table that refers to the primary key of another table.
Normalization is the process of organizing data in a database to minimize redundancy.
In DBMS, a transaction is a set of operations that are executed as a single unit of work.

Kotlin.question: Kotlin is a statically typed programming language that runs on the Java Virtual Machine.
In Kotlin, the 'if' keyword is used for conditional execution of code.
Kotlin supports null safety, meaning that a variable cannot be null unless it is explicitly declared as nullable.
In Kotlin, the 'when' keyword is used to create a switch statement.
Kotlin supports operator overloading.
In Kotlin, a class can inherit from multiple interfaces.
Kotlin supports extension functions, which allow a function to be added to an existing class without modifying the class itself.
Kotlin supports higher-order functions, which are functions that take other functions as parameters or return functions as results.
In Kotlin, the 'lateinit' keyword is used to specify that a variable will be initialized later.
Kotlin does not support checked exceptions.

Android.question: Android is an open-source operating system developed by Google.
In Android, an activity represents a single screen with a user interface.
The Android Manifest file contains information about the application, such as its package name, version, and required permissions.
In Android, the 'findViewById()' method is used to find a view by its ID.
A content provider in Android is used to share data between applications.
In Android, the 'onCreate()' method is called when an activity is first created.
The Android Application class is a base class for maintaining global application state.
In Android, the 'adb' tool is used to communicate with an emulator or a connected Android device.
Android supports multiple threads of execution, which can be used to perform time-consuming tasks without blocking the main thread.
In Android, a service is a component that runs in the background to perform long-running tasks.

DSA.question: An array is a data structure that stores a collection of elements of the same data type.
A linked list is a data structure in which each element is connected to the next element by a link.
In a stack data structure, the last element added is the first element to be removed.
A queue is a data structure in which elements are added at one end and removed from the other end.
A binary tree is a tree data structure in which each node has at most two children.
The time complexity of linear search is O(n), where n is the number of elements in the array.
Bubble sort is an efficient sorting algorithm with a time complexity of O(n log n).
The time complexity of binary search is O(log n), where n is the number of elements in the sorted array.
In recursion, a function calls itself directly or indirectly.
Dynamic programming is a technique used to solve problems by breaking them down into smaller subproblems and solving each subproblem only once.

Networking.question: A network is a collection of interconnected devices that can communicate with each other.
In the client-server model, the server is responsible for providing services to the clients.
The internet is a global network of interconnected computer networks.
TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) is a connectionless protocol that is used to transmit data over the internet.
UDP (User Datagram Protocol) is a connectionless protocol that is used for real-time applications such as video and audio streaming.
IP (Internet Protocol) is responsible for routing data packets from the source device to the destination device.
DNS (Domain Name System) is used to translate human-readable domain names into IP addresses.
HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) is a protocol used for secure communication over the internet.
Firewalls are used to protect networks from unauthorized access and malicious traffic.
A VPN (Virtual Private Network) allows users to securely access a private network over a public network such as the internet.
